
### unshared seek pointers  {.smaller}

if ‘‘foo.txt’’ contains ‘‘AB’’ 
```
int fd1 = open("foo.txt", O_RDONLY);
int fd2 = open("foo.txt", O_RDONLY);
char c;
read(fd1, &c, 1);
char d;
read(fd2, &d, 1);

```
 expected result: c = ‘A’, d = ‘A’

### shared seek pointers (1)  {.smaller}

if ‘‘foo.txt’’ contains ‘‘AB’’: 
```
int fd = open("foo.txt", O_RDONLY);
dup2(fd, 100);
char c;
read(fd, &c, 1);
char d;
read(100, &d, 1);

```
 expected result: c = ‘A’, d = ‘B’

### shared seek pointers (2)  {.smaller}

if ‘‘foo.txt’’ contains ‘‘AB’’: 
```
int fd = open("foo.txt", O_RDONLY);
pid_t p = fork();
if (p == 0) {
    char c;
    read(fd, &c, 1);
    ...
} else {
    char d;
    sleep(1);
    read(fd, &d, 1);
    ...
}

```
 expected result: c = ‘A’, d = ‘B’
